DataElement.preferredName: 6 Minute Walk Functional Test Exercise Duration Minute One Decimal Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Number to describe the amount of time in minutes required for an individual to complete the Six Minute Walk Test.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: 6 Minute Walk Functional Test Exercise Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale developed by Bruno Blake in 1963, which is a performance-based evaluation of functional exercise capacity in subjects with chronic respiratory disease and heart failure, as well as other populations such as healthy older adults and people suffering from fibromyalgia and scleroderma. This functional test contains 6 items and measures the distance an individual is able to walk over a total of six minutes on a hard, flat surface._Activity that requires physical or mental exertion, especially when performed to develop or maintain fitness._The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale developed by Bruno Blake in 1963, which is a performance-based evaluation of functional exercise capacity in subjects with chronic respiratory disease and heart failure, as well as other populations such as healthy older adults and people suffering from fibromyalgia and scleroderma. This functional test contains 6 items and measures the distance an individual is able to walk over a total of six minutes on a hard, flat surface.
